theorem ring_hom_eval₂_cast_int_ring_hom {R S : Type _} [Ring R] [Ring S] (p : polynomial ℤ) (f : «expr →+* » R S)

theorem map_aeval_eq_aeval_map {S T U : Type _} [CommSemiring S] [CommSemiring T] [Semiring U] [Algebra R S]
    [Algebra T U] {φ : «expr →+* » R T} {ψ : «expr →+* » S U} (h : (algebraMap T U).comp φ = ψ.comp (algebraMap R S))
    (p : polynomial R) (a : S) : ψ (aeval a p) = aeval (ψ a) (p.map φ) :=
  by
  conv_rhs => rw [aeval_def, ← eval_map]
  rw [map_map, h, ← map_map, eval_map, eval₂_at_apply, aeval_def, eval_map]

theorem eval₂_algebra_map_X {R A : Type _} [CommSemiring R] [Semiring A] [Algebra R A] (p : polynomial R)

#align eval_unique eval_unique
eval_mul_X_sub_C:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/-- The evaluation map is not generally multiplicative when the coefficient ring is noncommutative,
but nevertheless any polynomial of the form `p * (X - monomial 0 r)` is sent to zero
when evaluated at `r`.

This is the key step in our proof of the Cayley-Hamilton theorem.
-/
theorem eval_mul_X_sub_C {p : polynomial R} (r : R) : (p * (X - C r)).eval r = 0 :=
  by
  simp only [eval, eval₂, RingHom.id_apply]
  have bound :=
    calc
      (p * (X - C r)).nat_degree ≤ p.nat_degree + (X - C r).nat_degree := nat_degree_mul_le
      _ ≤ p.nat_degree + 1 := (add_le_add_left (nat_degree_X_sub_C_le _) _)
      _ < p.nat_degree + 2 := lt_add_one _
      
  rw [sum_over_range' _ _ (p.nat_degree + 2) bound]
  swap
  · simp
  rw [sum_range_succ']
  conv_lhs =>
    congr
    apply_congr
    skip
    rw [coeff_mul_X_sub_C, sub_mul, mul_assoc, ← pow_succ]
  simp [sum_range_sub', coeff_monomial]
#align eval_mul_X_sub_C eval_mul_X_sub_C
dvd_term_of_is_root_of_dvd_terms:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Basic.lean:635:2: warning: expanding binder collection (j «expr ≠ » i) -/
theorem dvd_term_of_is_root_of_dvd_terms {r p : S} {f : polynomial S} (i : ℕ) (hr : f.is_root r)
    (h : ∀ (j) (_ : j ≠ i), p ∣ f.coeff j * r ^ j) : p ∣ f.coeff i * r ^ i :=
  dvd_term_of_dvd_eval_of_dvd_terms i (Eq.symm hr ▸ dvd_zero p) h
#align dvd_term_of_is_root_of_dvd_terms dvd_term_of_is_root_of_dvd_terms
dvd_term_of_dvd_eval_of_dvd_terms:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Basic.lean:635:2: warning: expanding binder collection (j «expr ≠ » i) -/
theorem dvd_term_of_dvd_eval_of_dvd_terms {z p : S} {f : polynomial S} (i : ℕ) (dvd_eval : p ∣ f.eval z)
    (dvd_terms : ∀ (j) (_ : j ≠ i), p ∣ f.coeff j * z ^ j) : p ∣ f.coeff i * z ^ i :=
  by
  by_cases hi : i ∈ f.support
  · rw [eval, eval₂, Sum] at dvd_eval
    rw [← Finset.insert_erase hi, Finset.sum_insert (Finset.not_mem_erase _ _)] at dvd_eval
    refine' (dvd_add_left _).mp dvd_eval
    apply Finset.dvd_sum
    intro j hj
    exact dvd_terms j (Finset.ne_of_mem_erase hj)
  · convert dvd_zero p
    rw [not_mem_support_iff] at hi
    simp [hi]
#align dvd_term_of_dvd_eval_of_dvd_terms dvd_term_of_dvd_eval_of_dvd_terms

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/-- Extensionality lemma for algebra maps out of `A'[X]` over a smaller base ring than `A'`
-/
@[ext]
theorem alg_hom_ext' [Algebra R A'] [Algebra R B'] {f g : «expr →ₐ[ ] » (polynomial A') R B'}
    (h₁ : f.comp (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R A' (polynomial A')) = g.comp (IsScalarTower.toAlgHom R A' (polynomial A')))
    (h₂ : f X = g X) : f = g :=
  AlgHom.coe_ringHom_injective (Polynomial.ringHom_ext' (congr_arg alg_hom.to_ring_hom h₁) h₂)
#align alg_hom_ext' alg_hom_ext'

@[ext]
theorem alg_hom_ext {f g : «expr →ₐ[ ] » (polynomial R) R A} (h : f X = g X) : f = g :=
  AlgHom.ext_of_adjoin_eq_top adjoin_X fun p hp => (Set.mem_singleton_iff.1 hp).symm ▸ h

theorem aeval_bit0 : aeval x (bit0 p) = bit0 (aeval x p) :=

#align aeval_bit0 aeval_bit0
aeval_algebra_map_apply_eq_algebra_map_e:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
theorem aeval_algebra_map_apply_eq_algebra_map_eval (x : R) (p : polynomial R) :
    aeval (algebraMap R A x) p = algebraMap R A (p.eval x) :=
  aeval_algHom_apply (Algebra.ofId R A) x p
#align aeval_algebra_map_apply_eq_algebra_map_eval aeval_algebra_map_apply_eq_algebra_map_eval
aeval_alg_hom_apply:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
theorem aeval_alg_hom_apply {F : Type _} [AlgHomClass F R A B] (f : F) (x : A) (p : polynomial R) :
    aeval (f x) p = f (aeval x p) :=
  by
  refine' Polynomial.induction_on p (by simp) (fun p q hp hq => _) (by simp)
  rw [map_add, hp, hq, ← map_add, ← map_add]
#align aeval_alg_hom_apply aeval_alg_hom_apply
aeval_alg_hom:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₐ[ ] » -/
theorem aeval_alg_hom (f : «expr →ₐ[ ] » A R B) (x : A) : aeval (f x) = f.comp (aeval x) :=
  algHom_ext <| by simp only [aeval_X, AlgHom.comp_apply]
#align aeval_alg_hom aeval_alg_hom
aeval_alg_equiv:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₐ[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ₐ[ ] » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr →ₐ[ ] » -/
theorem aeval_alg_equiv (f : «expr ≃ₐ[ ] » A R B) (x : A) : aeval (f x) = (f : «expr →ₐ[ ] » A R B).comp (aeval x) :=
  aeval_algHom (f : «expr →ₐ[ ] » A R B) x
#align aeval_alg_equiv aeval_alg_equiv
aeval_add:
@[simp]
theorem aeval_add : aeval x (p + q) = aeval x p + aeval x q :=
  AlgHom.map_add _ _ _
#align aeval_add aeval_add
aeval_X_pow:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
@[simp]
theorem aeval_X_pow {n : ℕ} : aeval x ((X : polynomial R) ^ n) = x ^ n :=
  eval₂_X_pow _ _
#align aeval_X_pow aeval_X_pow
aeval_X_left_apply:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
theorem aeval_X_left_apply (p : polynomial R) : aeval X p = p :=
  AlgHom.congr_fun (@aeval_X_left R _) p
#align aeval_X_left_apply aeval_X_left_apply
aeval_X_left:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
@[simp]
theorem aeval_X_left : aeval (X : polynomial R) = AlgHom.id R (polynomial R) :=
  algHom_ext <| aeval_X X
#align aeval_X_left aeval_X_left
aeval_X:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
@[simp]
theorem aeval_X : aeval x (X : polynomial R) = x :=
  eval₂_X _ x
#align aeval_X aeval_X
aeval_C:
@[simp]
theorem aeval_C (r : R) : aeval x (C r) = algebraMap R A r :=
  eval₂_C _ x
#align aeval_C aeval_C
adjoin_singleton_eq_range_aeval:
#print Algebra.adjoin_singleton_eq_range_aeval /-
theorem Algebra.adjoin_singleton_eq_range_aeval (x : A) : Algebra.adjoin R {x} = (Polynomial.aeval x).range := by
  rw [← Algebra.map_top, ← adjoin_X, AlgHom.map_adjoin, Set.image_singleton, aeval_X]
#align algebra.adjoin_singleton_eq_range_aeval Algebra.adjoin_singleton_eq_range_aeval
-/
adjoin_X:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⊤» -/
@[simp]
theorem adjoin_X : Algebra.adjoin R ({X} : Set (polynomial R)) = «expr⊤» :=
  by
  refine' top_unique fun p hp => _
  set S := Algebra.adjoin R ({X} : Set (polynomial R))
  rw [← sum_monomial_eq p]; simp only [← smul_X_eq_monomial, Sum]
  exact S.sum_mem fun n hn => S.smul_mem (S.pow_mem (Algebra.subset_adjoin rfl) _) _
#align adjoin_X adjoin_X
C_eq_algebra_map:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/-- When we have `[comm_semiring R]`, the function `C` is the same as `algebra_map R R[X]`.

(But note that `C` is defined when `R` is not necessarily commutative, in which case
`algebra_map` is not available.)
-/
theorem C_eq_algebra_map (r : R) : C r = algebraMap R (polynomial R) r :=
  rfl
#align C_eq_algebra_map C_eq_algebra_map
